response_requirements.initial_response_description: Idaho residents: 3 working days to grant or deny request; if longer needed, notify in writing and provide within 10 working days
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Idaho residents: max 10 working days if additional time needed. Non-residents: up to 35 calendar days
response_requirements.extension_notes: Idaho residents: 7 additional working days after initial 3 if needed. Non-residents: up to 35 calendar days total
response_requirements.non_resident_timeline: Up to 35 calendar days for non-residents

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Cannot exceed actual labor and copying costs; based on lowest-paid staff capable of task
fee_structure.fee_waiver_criteria: May waive if request contributes significantly to public understanding of government operations or activities

exemptions.description: Records where disclosure would invade personal privacy
Trade secrets and confidential commercial information

appeal_process.first_level_notes: No administrative appeal; direct court enforcement
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award attorney fees and costs

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: No need to state purpose for request
requester_requirements.residency_notes: Idaho residents: 3-10 working days. Non-residents: up to 35 calendar days
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written request required to designated custodian; must clearly indicate it's a public records request

agency_obligations.presumption_of_openness: All public records presumed open unless specifically exempted by statute
agency_obligations.reorganization_note: 2015 reorganization consolidated transparency laws under Title 74

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields manually verified from official Idaho statute. Reorganized to Title 74 in 2015 for unified transparency law location. Idaho residents: 3 working days (10 max). Non-residents: 35 calendar days. Fee waivers if contributes to public understanding. Actual labor and copying costs only. Presumption of openness. District court enforcement with attorney fees.
